intro: Tristania floribunda, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches. Tristania floribunda is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
